intro: Disakisperma yemenicum, commonly known as the Yemen spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
